# Warren's Opera House

| locmapin     = Nebraska#USA
| map_caption  = Location in Nebraska##Location in United States
| built        =
| builder      = John Lanahan
| architecture = Three-part commercial block
| added        = September 28, 1988
| area         = less than one acre
| mpsub        = [https://npgallery.nps.gov/pdfhost/docs/NRHP/Text/64500391.pdf Opera House Buildings in Nebraska 1867-1917 MPS]
| refnum       = 88000945
}}
'''Warren's Opera House''' is a historic building in Friend, Nebraska. It was built by John Lanahan for Joshua Warren, a wealthy Canadian grain merchant, in 1885â€“1886. Inside, there is an auditorium with a proscenium and a balcony supported by four columns. It hosted performances by "touring stock companies; comic opera; companies; musical concerts; dialect comedies" as well as local performers and Memorial Day celebrations. The building has been listed on the National Register of Historic Places since September 28, 1988.
